inactive.biases: She is suspicious of people that Bartelby, Titus, or Lucretzia distrust or dislike, though if Bartelby if helpful, her suspicious nature is supplanted with skeptic optimism and favor.
inactive.skills: Bluff, Diplomacy, K: Arcana, K: Planes, and Spellcraft.

pc.title: Baron
pc.name: Rodrigo *High-Five*
pc.appearance: His beard and hair are trimmed and neat, and he looks much the same as the rest of his many siblings.
pc.background: Being 11th in line for his family wealth, he chose to strive to make a name for himself and become a senator. With the backing of his - albeit lesser - family name and a small stipend, he has otherwise struck out on his own path. Largely, he spent his time working as a senatorial aid before he was contacted by Martella Lotheed.
pc.biases: He prefers the fine things in life and being able to flaunt his position and power in support of the people, and likes those who give him such opportunities or shares those same goals. He hates repeating himself, however, and when he feels ignored, he will promptly turn cold.
pc.strengths: Anything meant to embarrass or ridicule Rodrigo will stoke his Ire and discourage continued relations.
pc.weakness: With a fear of being forgotten to time, opportunities to make a name for himself quickly gain his interest.
pc.achievements: Rescued Martella Lotheed, Slaying the Iron Lash of Meratt, Won the Dance of the Phalanx, Won the Holmgang, Caught the General, Claimed the Palace of Birdsong, Stopped the Nightmares of Yanmass, Ended the Caravan Raids, Rescued the Twilight Child, Trained at the Kithroadian Academy, Captured Abadar's Pillar, Uncovered the Tomb of the First Emperor, Rescued Taldaris from his Captors, Slayed Norbergers Harold - The Stinging Beast, Received the Eternal Crown from Yanmass

pc.title: Chacoom
pc.name: Ickth
pc.achievements: Uncovered the Tomb of the First Emperor, Was Elected Councilor of Gates in Sayashto on Axis, Rescued Taldaris from his Captors, Slayed Norbergers Harold - The Stinging Beast, Received the Eternal Crown from Yanmass

pc.title: Baroness
pc.name: Maven *Mai* Selina Rosaline *Twinkle Toes*
pc.appearance: With black hair and blue eyes, Mai Vernisant sticks out amongst her blond-hair brown-eyed family. Short with creamy white skin, she seems unnaturally attractive.
pc.background: Despite being born in a major noble family, Mai has been left inexplicably as an outcast and looks different from her cousins. Some whisper she has a tainted parentage, while others believe she was the result of a dark ritual or pact made with extraplanar forces. An only child, her mother called Mai her *Little Starlight* and considers herself lucky to have a daughter.
pc.biases: She has a fondness for sweet and savory foods, especially pies, and she detests those who consistently dominate conversations.
pc.strengths: While she retains her composure gracefully in public, Mai does not excel in patience and detests dragging conversations or any other thing that feels like a waste of time.
pc.weakness: Mai becomes attached to others very easily, and threats towards her friends or loved ones can quickly motivate her to be more amenable to requests.
pc.achievements: Rescued Martella Lotheed, Slaying the Iron Lash of Meratt, Won the Dance of the Phalanx, Caught the General, Claimed the Palace of Birdsong, Stopped the Nightmares of Yanmass, Ended the Caravan Raids, Rescued the Twilight Child, Trained at the Kithroadian Academy, Captured Abadar's Pillar, Uncovered the Tomb of the First Emperor, Rescued Taldaris from his Captors, Slayed Norbergers Harold - The Stinging Beast, Received the Eternal Crown from Yanmass

pc.title: Baronet
pc.name: Robin *Double-Tap*
pc.appearance: Clean shaven with bright eyes, Robin of Loxley of Nottingham has a great singing voice and is a surprisingly good dancer.
pc.background: An adventurer, Robin of Loxley left his home seeking fame and honor for his family name along with personal adventure and excitement.
pc.biases: Loves the poor, hates the rich and snobbish.
pc.achievements: Claimed the Palace of Birdsong, Stopped the Nightmares of Yanmass, Ended the Caravan Raids, Rescued the Twilight Child, Trained at the Kithroadian Academy, Captured Abadar's Pillar, Uncovered the Tomb of the First Emperor, Rescued Taldaris from his Captors, Slayed Norbergers Harold - The Stinging Beast, Received the Eternal Crown from Yanmass

pc.title: Baronet
pc.name: Orm *Top Knot*
pc.appearance: Cheery and attractive, Orm likes to wear tight and cropped clothing in taldan blue, comfortable enough to move in easily, while just conservative enough to be both proper and obviously a bard.
pc.background: Trained at the famous Kithrodian Academy, Lord Orm learned to enjoy the finer things in life - music, theater, women, drink, and fashion. When his family name was dragged through the mud by Maxillar Pythareus' political machinations, he promised himself he would restore his family's name while delivering cool vengence. She was recently reincarnated as a female half-orc, though many people who've known her the longest just assumer this is her latest persona.
pc.biases: Orm is partial to anyone pretty or anyone who pays her attention, though she does not care for drab and muted fashion or public followers of Pythareus. While she does not despise them, she does not trust the military, generally.
pc.strengths: Proud and self assured, Orm is can spot both quality and fakes and is likewise difficult to deceive.
pc.weakness: Takes insults personally and critisism poorly.
pc.achievements: Ended the Caravan Raids, Rescued the Twilight Child, Trained at the Kithroadian Academy, Captured Abadar's Pillar, Uncovered the Tomb of the First Emperor, Rescued Taldaris from his Captors, Slayed Norbergers Harold - The Stinging Beast, Received the Eternal Crown from Yanmass
pc.classes: Knife Master Rogue 5, Sensei Monk 1, Lion Blade 9

pc.title: Baronet
pc.name: Debrah *Little Debbie*
pc.achievements: Rescued Taldaris from his Captors, Slayed Norbergers Harold - The Stinging Beast, Received the Eternal Crown from Yanmass

legacy.title: Grand Duke
legacy.name: Urjinus
legacy.appearance: As his true passions are riding and hunting, he is most often seen wearing crisp noble cloth without jewelry and atop his favorite horse, Jackson.
legacy.background: The Grand Duke of Sophra, this ineffectual politician defers in almost all situations to High Strategos Maxillar Pythareus, in part due to his Duchy's history in ruling jointly with Taldor's supreme military commander, and partly due to his own middling history as an officer compared to Pythareus's record and ties to the crown.
legacy.biases: Recognizing service and its importance, he has a strong bias for people in the military or pledged to specific orders (+4), and a bias against undisciplined and chaotic people (-2).
legacy.strengths: While only having a middling service record, Grand Duke Vobellar still knows a great deal about the military, defense, tactics, and strategic resources/ locations.
legacy.weakness: With a deep love for riding and hunting, Grand Duke Vobellar is easily regailed by stories of prior hunts or rummors of legendary game.
legacy.skills: Diplomacy, K: Nature, Pro: Soldier, Ride, or Survival

legacy.title: Chacoom
legacy.name: Vul
legacy.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. Vul sticks out thanks to his eyebrows, and the Yashtoma he often carries with him while officiating, a quirk that makes him easy to recognize.
legacy.background: The Councilor of Seeds, Croafto represents Sayashto's iconic Yashtoma industry and deals with affairs of agriculture, parks, and pest control.

legacy.title: Chacoom
legacy.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
legacy.background: The former Councilor of Gates, Eopal was in charge of publicity, immigration, tourism, and trade. He suddenly resigned a short time ago and secluded himself at home, which is especially odd considering that he was only 340 days into his 2,000 day term.

legacy.title: Chacoom
legacy.appearance: A proud cleric of Abadar from the city of Brass, Hlati is one of ony six dozen Azer's in Sayashto, and the only one that carries a warhammer as part of his oficial capacity.
legacy.background: The Councilor of Canals, Hlati is responsible for coordinating Sayashto's roads, bridges, and canals, along with informally representing the interests of neighboring districts.

legacy.title: Chacoom
legacy.name: Trakt
legacy.appearance: Like the vast majority of Axiomites, Trakt is a craftsman and an enchanter, and he can easily be recognized by the specific geometry leaking through his flesh, that is, to anyone who can read divine geometry and comprehend it.
legacy.background: The Councilor of Laws, Imil differs from the other, elected, councilors by being an advisor appointed by authorities in Aktun to represent Axis as a whole. This role is more of an advisory role, though it does carry the authority to veto measures entirely should they deem it necessary.

legacy.title: Chacoom
legacy.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
legacy.background: The Councilor of Graves, Jolmulk oversees legislation for the local mortuary industry, presides over major holidays, and serves as a symbolic representative for the district's long-term residents.

legacy.title: Father
legacy.appearance: Incredibly old and with a broken spirit Father Basri shambles to and fro, reminding the Taldor traditionalists of their old deific patron, the Last Azlanti. The sadness of his patron’s death and the years since have weighed heavily on his shoulders, and he walks with a stooped back, leaning heavily on a cane.
legacy.background: Father Basri maintains the Basilica of the Last Man as a tourist attraction, keeping Aroden at least somewhat alive and remembered. As a State Archbishop, Father Basri has a permanent invitation to state celebrations, and uses the opportunity to raise donations for his dwindling church.

legacy.title: Lady
legacy.name: Hallianna
legacy.appearance: Derisive and snide, Lady Hallianna Cobbin delights in making others feel uncomfortable and awkward, especially *noble-born's*. She is often seen wearing flowy and flowery clothing, and she can quickly change from looking cute and innocent to sarcastic and derisive.
legacy.background: An owner of several large orchards and ranches, Lady Hallianna Cobbin's father was the chief manager for an heirless human aristocrat who bequeathed both her lands and title to her favorite employee upon her death. The only halfling family to ever sit on the Mercantile Council, Cobbin is not particularly political, but is full of gossip and controls a vast majority of the food and equine trade in Yanmass.

legacy.title: Lady
legacy.name: Aumber
legacy.appearance: With fair elven skin, long dark hair, and a pique fashion sense, Lady Aumber Gewbell is graceful, to put it mildly. Soft-spoken with fluid movements, she often wears natural-scented perfume and never-ever wears the same outfit twice.
legacy.background: A clothing importer and exporter, Lady Aumber Gewbell speaks directly with the citizenry and traders in Yanmass much more than the other councilors. Seemingly much more sympathetic than the other Mercantile Principles, especially to other non-humans, she is nonetheless skeptical of others, especially those who try to appeal to her directly.

legacy.title: Lord
legacy.appearance: [redacted] - By arrangement with Gulresh, all descriptions of him have been redacted and will not be recorded by the [redacted] until after [redacted] has expired.
legacy.background: The most powerful information broker and crime boss in Zimar and self-proclaimed *Lord of Filth* master of the Zimar Undercity, Gulresh has rules beneath Zimar, escaping capture, making deals, and receiving payment and offerings from decades of blacksmiths, corsairs, rogues, and spies. Often considered neutral territory by both sanctioned and unsanctioned spies and scoundrels, Gulresh has agreed to [redacted] providing his *Court of Filth* freedom from sentinel patrols in exchange for [redacted].

legacy.title: Chief Enumerator
legacy.name: Abrun
legacy.appearance: Dressed Proudly in Golden Enumerator Plate armor, Chief Enumerator Abrun Palliettor cuts a striking figure. While he looks fierce, he cares deeply for the people and the law, upholding justice fervently, but always speaking with measured words and a soft, calm voice.
legacy.background: The High Priest of the church of Abadar in Yanmass, and the second-highest ranking member of the church in all of Taldor, Chief Enumerator Abrun Palliettor is a Principle on the Mercantile Council because of how important the Temple of Abadar is to both currency conversion and tax collection for the city. Known for his silence, his neutrality, and his inflexibility with regards to the law, he is popular with the citizenry and with traders, though he's rarely seen outside of his professional or spiritual capacity. Was recently apointed as the head of the church of Taldor following the death of Palo Iovinus.
legacy.biases: Loves lawful people; hates chaotic people and those convicted of a felony in the last year.

legacy.title: Special Agent
legacy.appearance: Usually seen peacefully drinking yasht at Pakhtil's, Qarit is polite though often nihilistically dismisive of others, and he positively exudes dread, bothering many of those whom are not immune.
legacy.background: An embodiement of death, Qarit is a powerful Shinigami that has pursued dangerous fugitives, despoilers, and the unnaturally long-lived for more than 10,000 years.

legacy.title: Lady
legacy.name: Carmellio
legacy.appearance: Easily her most distinctive feature are the golden under-eye tattoo's after the fashion of the Padisha Empire of Kelesh. Lady Camellio Rauls has a cheerful disposition and a fair, Taldan complexion, but often wears a mix of Taldan and Kelesh fashion and weaponry.
legacy.background: The primary armor, weapon, and equestrian gear merchant in Yanmass, her house holds a lucrative contract to supply the Taldan Horse across the empire. While equally affected by taxes on the export of military gear, her tax-exempt status on the import of gear destined for the Taldan Horse makes her the preferred buyer for Kelish merchants selling their crafts.
legacy.biases: Favors riders, disfavors those who cannot.

legacy.title: Agent
legacy.appearance: With a deeply penetrating stare, Jihtin locks eyes with his target and wont ever let them escape until he's sold them the Home of their Dreams!
legacy.background: A fabulously successful real-estate agent, Jihtin loves showing off the magical properties of the Specie Spring located in the center of the upscale neighborhood of the same name.

legacy.title: Chief Postal Inspector
legacy.appearance: The tall, blue-skinned Omaln wears in loose, flowing robes, and his strange face has too many eyes while his hands have too few fingers.
legacy.background: The Chief Postal Inspector of the Sayashto Postal Service, Omaln has been consistently revising quality-control procedures with little effect as she struggles to meet Zdareen District Standards.

legacy.title: Electorate
legacy.appearance: This warm medusa immigrant happily greets all the constituents and voters that cross her path, casting her eyes about freely and without care since outsiders are typically immune to the dangers of meeting her gaze.
legacy.background: A friendly Medusa who immigrated to Sayashto five years ago, Tsemani is running for the position of Interim Councilor of Gates in the void left by Eopal's resignation.

legacy.title: Earl
legacy.name: Gahez
legacy.appearance: A tall man, Gahez keeps a weary smile on his face while dealing with some of his colleagues in the senate. His long black hair falls loosely past his shoulders. His clothing is road worn and a mesh of various regional styles, as though he moves around frequently and hasn't quite settled in.
legacy.background: The senate representative from northeast of Zimar, Earl Gahez Varima traces his lineage back to the first Vudrani immigrants to Taldor.

legacy.title: Head Curator
legacy.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
legacy.background: A renown interplanar botanist, Head Curator Zjali administrates the Striped Palace, a museum dedicated to the history, cultivation, and processing of the yashtoma plant.

legacy.title: Countess
legacy.name: Abrielle
legacy.appearance: Only ridiculously gauche noble clothing and fine jewelry set Countess Pace apart from any other Taldan. Her face is usually in a smile, though it quickly turns to a sneer when she loses control of the conversation. She has short but well-kept brown hair locked back in a stylized bun.
legacy.background: A countess and member of the senate from a county along the western borders of Taldor, Abrielle Pace seeks to advance by any means available.

legacy.title: Count
legacy.name: Orlundo *The Iron Gar*
legacy.appearance: Orlundo wears traditional Taldan outfits that seem a bit over starched. His graying, short hair is smoothed back from his tired face. Worn around the edges, Zespire keeps his smiles subdued and almost flat.
legacy.background: The “Iron Gar” made a name for himself hunting pirates for the Grand Prince, granted a vacant senate seat for a successful pirate hunt that lead into River Kingdoms.

legacy.title: Viscount
legacy.name: Yemis
legacy.appearance: A middle-noble, Yemis Avenlar dressess well and cuts a nice figure despite his advacing age, and at the same time has an abundance of both arrogant an placative tendancies and bodylanguage. He walks like a man who is sure of what he owns, both confident in his power and afraid to lose it at the anger of his betters.
legacy.background: The Viscount overseeing the Piltshaven lands, Yemis Avenlar is an ambitious individual. With the landgrave over him and the local barons having died in the recent succession skirmishes, and the lands in question being too small-time for the attention of more powerful nobles, Avenlar has been rapidly consolidating both land and power.

legacy.name: Higgins
legacy.appearance: Friendly and subservient, Higgins dressess simply and cherily addresses his customers needs despite being wealthy enough to own a shop in Axis while still being mortal.
legacy.background: The proprieter and head barber at Silver Snips, Mister Higgins coordinaates his crew of halfling barber-surgeons with precision while creating an enviornment where people like to hang out, chat, and post help-wanted adds.

legacy.title: Baron
legacy.name: Mauston
legacy.appearance: Having not been seen in public for a long time, this elderly baron is now a few years older than depicted in his last portrait, and it cannot be relied upon for accuracy.
legacy.background: The Baron of Yanmass and arguably the most powerful person in the city because of his unique authority to veto Mercantile Council decisions, Baron Mauston Kustios is rarely seen in public, preferring the private life his manor affords him. For the last several years, he has not attended Mercantile Council meetings with the excuse of not feeling well, though many whisper it is because he has become little more than a figurehead and is no longer welcome at the meetings.
legacy.biases: The baron doesn't care for spellcasters of any kind, but he does have a soft spot for regular people with at least two different proffesions or crafts.

legacy.title: Petitioner
legacy.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
legacy.background: Founder and proprietor of Sayashto's oldest and most popular Yasht Shop, Pakhtil smuggly insists that she sells the best yasht in existance, and based on the long lines that form during the morning rush, she's probably right.

legacy.title: Captain
legacy.name: Thrain
legacy.appearance: Green and heavily pierced, this self-assured noble captain displays zero interest in politics or diplomacy, and dresses simply in high-quality armor.
legacy.background: Warden of Abadar's Pillar, and one of the few half-orcs in Taldor to hold a noble title, Captain Thrain Gavian is a descendent from a long line of faithful soldiers who served in and since the Grand Campaign. She was defeated by the PC's during their assualt on Abadar's Pillar, though his life was spared.

legacy.title: Magistrate
legacy.name: Joleana
legacy.appearance: In her late sixties, Magistrate Joleana Tantriano wears an Iomedae pin as the clasp to her Abadaran Judicial cloak, along with one earing of Iomedae's sun and another of Abadar's scales, denoting both her station and her dual faiths.
legacy.background: A magistrate in Cassomir and part of the Taldan upper class, Magistrate Joleana served an extended military tour in Lastwall in adition to her university education.
legacy.biases: She is biased towards agents of the law and followers of good or lawful dieties and against followers of evil or non-good chaotic dieties.
legacy.weakness: Referencing Iomedae's historical deeds or specific legal knowledge is best suited to influencing the magistrate.

legacy.title: Inquisitor General
legacy.name: Feradica
legacy.appearance: A devout man and a dedicated Inquisitor, Feradica Torcamay lost an eye defending his golden-masked taxmasters from ambush by Qadiran spies and thieves. While a traditional stoic man, he has become more complacent with cruelty since Enumerator Iovinus was appointed over him and his faith.
legacy.background: The tyrannical subordinate of Enumerator Iovinus, Inquisitor General Feradica Torcamay oversees the daily responsibilities of the House of Gold and of both the Golden Templars and the Templars of the Vault and Chain. While the ancient Taxmasters and the heretical Vault and Chain have different philosophies, these paramilitary orders work and train side-by-side, serve the same deity and enumerator, and defend Zimar and Taldors markets from foreign intervention.

legacy.title: Captain
legacy.name: Patrika
legacy.appearance: Dressed in sharp, angular armor with radical blue hair and highly angular designs, Captain Urba is formal and curt, asks pointed questions, and does not give the *uneducated brunt's* of either nobles or commoners any more attention than absolutely necessary.
legacy.background: The Captain of the Guard of Zimar and ultimately in charge of all civil defense in the city, Captain Patrika Urba is a taciturn engineer and an intelligent and devoted spellmaster. They was made into a double agent and turned on Pyhtareus during the assault on Abadar's Pillar.
legacy.strengths: Captain Urba is generally against any conversations or actions leading to reforms of any kind.
legacy.weakness: Captain urba is devoid of sympathy for anyone.
legacy.skills: Intimidate, K: Arcana, Spellcraft, or Linguistics

legacy.title: Baronet
legacy.name: Caphridius
legacy.appearance: Dressed in worn nobles clothing, Caphridius looks grim and tired. A gregarious man and happy to meet visitors, he can’t help but mention his community’s struggles, lack of resources, and poor infrastructure.
legacy.background: Count Caliphalig Vort's cousin and the again-assistant to Baron Telus, Caphridius is far more interested in acting and opera than frontier living. Though miserable, he continues to work hard to lead his community, while quietly nursing a self-loathing.
legacy.biases: Can't stand misery people or behavior.
legacy.strengths: Knows more than he'd like about farming and city planning.

legacy.title: Lord
legacy.appearance: Dressed in thick taldan green silk and wearing a large hat and carrying a big stick, this chef looks an awful lot like a magician. He admits he uses magic to enhance his cooking, promising the best food in all of Avin
legacy.background: The proprietor of the new, upscale restaurant, Savories, Argentus is an unethical self-promoter, working hard to be known as the finest chef in Avin.
legacy.biases: Shameless distaste for the poor, especially halflings, and refuses to serve them in his restaurant.

legacy.name: Yarelle
legacy.appearance: Friendly and welcoming, she has gray hair and watchful eyes.
legacy.background: A distant cousin - several times removed - of Adella Voinum, Yarelle studied the arcane in Oppara only to discover she missed the country side. She now helps to lead the tiny hamlet of Cascina.
legacy.skills: Bluff, Diplomacy, Spellcraft, K: Arcana, Craft (any), ???

legacy.title: Knight
legacy.appearance: Prioritizing form over function, Dame Avenna nonetheless looks every bit the part of all-seeing all-knowing diviner. While generally soft-spoken, she speaks definitively.
legacy.background: The personal court wizard of Maxillar Pythareus and member of his cabinet, Avenna serves the High Strategos as a diviner and seer, scrying on enemies and making educated guesses about their next moves. Intelligence suggests she considers herself an academic as opposed to a soldier, and as such, may be the least devout member of Pythareus's inner circle. She was convinced to leave Pythareus' side during the assault on Abadar's Pillar, and has remained in the company of her friend, Cateline Lotheed.

legacy.title: Sergeant
legacy.name: Valania
legacy.appearance: Fierce and determined, Sergeant Goen wears the same uniform as the other Zimar Sentinels, though that armor is both high quality and distinctive.
legacy.background: A renown fencer, Sergeant Goen oversees the general gate security of Zimar and both the Azlanti Tower and the Oubliette in Abadar's Pillar. The daughter of a prominent merchant family in Zimar, she reportedly enlisted with the hope that her service would eventually lead to a title. She was made into a double agent and turned on Pyhtareus during the assault on Abadar's Pillar.

legacy.title: Chief
legacy.name: Milxena
legacy.appearance: Wearing the firewatch's classic red-and-black armor, Chief Milxena is pretty and young for a firewatch chief. Passionate about many things, she seems to have a fire within her, especially when it comes to defending the city, even if its just from immigrants.
legacy.background: Chief of the firewatch, Yanmass's combination fire and police department, Chief Milxena Ospher is a skilled administrator, but also an unabashed racist. Statistically, her firewatch patrol Kelesh areas far less than Taldan districts, and more cases regarding Keleshite victims go unsolved than all other cases. Despite repeated outcries for her removal, she is part of a connected noble family and remains in charge.

legacy.title: Auntie
legacy.name: Drusilla
legacy.appearance: Foppish, gregarious, and grandmotherly, Drusilla Grava is good with children, quick to dole out sweets, and seemingly unconcerned that her toy shop doesn't get a lot of business.
legacy.background: The owner of a small puzzle and toy shop, Drusilla Grava would not be a person of interest if it were not for the frequency with which her name appears on reports from the city and the fact that she maintains a prosperous business despite her shop being small and child-centric.

legacy.name: Gregor
legacy.appearance: Incredibly talkative and swift footed, Gregor Hamble has no problem keeping up with the taller folk he assists, both in conversation and pace. Dressed commonly, but far better than a slave, he is ever cheerful and happy to serve, though he does not disclose secrets, despite many attempts to pry them free.
legacy.background: The Guest Secretary of the Mercantile Council, Gregor Hamble's job is to assist guests of the council and coordinate logistics between the council guests and the council main. He'd have a reputation for loose lips, given how much he talks and how he strives to answer questions before they're asked, but he has never yet revealed a secret he was supposed to keep, making him perfect for his job.

legacy.title: Master
legacy.name: Frater
legacy.appearance: When seen out and about, he wears Baron Telus' colors beneath his muted green game-wardens cloth, often making him blend in to the environment. He's trained his men to do likewise, and while there's no evidence anything they do is outside the confines of the law, others view them as bandits.
legacy.background: Baron Telus' game warden, Master Frater Mosle grew up with Araig and possibly knows him better than anyone else. Protective of his underlings and Baron Telus, he turns away everyone seeking the Baron, explaining that he is still recovering.

legacy.name: River
legacy.appearance: As no one has ever seen the River Mother's face, no description is available.
legacy.background: Known locally as the river mother, this elderly druid tends to the downtrodden poor living in the Wash, though everything about *her* is unknown, including race and gender, as the River Mother keeps their heavy hood over their face even while providing magical aid.

legacy.title: Master Storyteller
legacy.name: Conson
legacy.appearance: Seven feet tall and easily over three hundred pounds, this massive, gregarious half-elf is twice over most other men. He sings unashamedly, he tells stories with a deep memory, he stirs deep, raw feelings from inside his audience, and he drinks as much ale as a horse drinks water.
legacy.background: A master storyteller, Conson Vatherial usually performs out of the Whistling Wyvern and is well known for matching adventurers and mercenaries looking for employment with merchants and nobles looking for guards and explorers.

legacy.title: Blackwater
legacy.appearance: Description unavailable, despite bribes and threats.
legacy.background: A popular duelist, the champion known as *Blackwater* is known to fight in illegal underground fight clubs. A celebrity in name, her identity is a mystery, and there are none willing to disclose her description.

legacy.name: Sepsina
legacy.appearance: Sepsina is rail-thin and pale, looking vaguely surprised or frightened by everything, though her eyes have a bit of piece behind them, and she's begun answering questions more completely.
legacy.background: Dame Crabbe's daughter, Sepsina fell into despondency after the suicide of her fiancé. After being disenchanted, she's become more outgoing while also not attending as many social events.

legacy.name: Giado
legacy.appearance: Bearing a tax license, Giado wears a combination of oversized clothing in reds, blacks, and dark blues. He always travels with a retinue of worker guards.
legacy.background: Giado comes by once or twice each year to many of the outlying towns and settlements to claim levy taxes from towns not directly overseen by a baron or the flamboyant Dame Crabbe. When confronted, he uses magic to bully and frighten locals.

legacy.name: Arraio
legacy.appearance: This jolly orator is both plump and tidy. Often bathing with specialized bath salts, tending to his hair and goatee with pricey oils, and always wearing freshly laundered and scented clothing, Arraio has a clean look and a complex scented profile.
legacy.background: The proprietor of the Baths of Dioclytus, the largest and most famous of Zimar's bathhouses - which also includes a laundry, café, massage parlor, and upscale inn - this wealthy bard makes his living providing a comfortable place to rest after a journey and spill secrets.

legacy.name: Mirissin
legacy.appearance: Miss Halvelor has striking red hair and amber eyes. Beyond that, she does her best to blend fashion and function by mixing custom, quiet armor with custom cut cloth. She is rarely seen carrying a weapon, but no one ever doubts that she is armed. When she speaks, it is only to answer or turn customers away, and she has a tendency to use unnecessarily long words.
legacy.background: The owner of one of Yanmass's most opulent inns, the Gilded Baldachin, little is known about Mirissin Halvelor except that she is well known for her and her employees discretion, along with the intense security measures she takes to keep her guests safe and undisturbed. This reputation is well earned since her guards protected a visiting Grand Dukes son and heir from kidnapping by Kelesh Insurgents, and the disturbance only came to light months later when the heir apparent was bragging about his survival. Lady Martella Lotheed has sent a letter ahead to arrange for rooms at her inn, along with a private lounge and workshop, with payment to be billed to Princess Eutropia's account.

legacy.appearance: A fisherman living in an old beaver dam, Jeke smells cleaner than you'd expect, but his body odor is still strong.
legacy.background: An old man tired of city life, Jeke calls himself *The General's Butler* and tells fishing stories to other anglers near the lake.

legacy.title: Master
legacy.appearance: No known sketch or description exists. Update - Sketch found in Milon Jeroth's Portfolio.
legacy.background: The only known piece of information on Oaca is [redacted] before becoming a spy employed by Milon Jeroth. Oaca is presumed to be both capable and lethal.

legacy.name: Anllel
legacy.appearance: Wearing druidic and lodge greens, Anllel is poised and defiant.
legacy.background: A lodge member, she looks at the community of Stachys with equal distrust as they look upon her.

legacy.name: Portimer
legacy.appearance: With threadbare clothing and a little brown hat, protomer is covered in faded bruises and scars and seems generally skittish and servile despite his cheery disposition.
legacy.background: The local miller, protomer is a husband and father to three scrawny children aged 5, 11, and 14. After the town rallied around him, he was released from custody without charge.

legacy.name: Saviana
legacy.appearance: With long dark hair and clothes cut a lower than is normally accepted in this part of the world -though not so low as to be indecorous- Miss Saviana Onio obviously uses her looks and charm while trying to make a sale. With certain buyers, she has been known to wear the magical jewelry she's showcasing, and she has never been seen in public without a few magical items, including her signature circlet of persuasion inlaid with aquamarine and accompanied by matching earrings.
legacy.background: The owner of a popular magic item shop, Wender Manor, Savina Onio personally curates her extensive collection and showcases the wares to pre-screened guests. Though undoubtedly wealthy, no thieves have successfully overcome Onio's expensive defenses, with thieves' bodies often being disposed of quietly before working hours.

legacy.appearance: This bookish elf wears travelers clothing and carries several kinds of bags of various sizes.
legacy.background: A smuggler contact often utilized by the Lion Blades, Cyricus helps Lion Blades acquire identification papers, disguises, and information within and around the border region between Taldor's Zimar and Qadira. These things are either acquired by Cyricus himself, or left behind by other Lion Blades, which Cyricus is happy to provide for only a modest fee.

legacy.appearance: Dressed in ratty, third-hand clothing, Felsha is often seen in the streets of towns begging for help.
legacy.background: An advocate for Jambis, Felsha became interesting when she was attacked by assailants on the road only to be saved by someone she now calls

legacy.name: Partulles
legacy.appearance: Dressed in homespun long johns, Partulles' face is wrinkled into a permanent scowl, with a few sharp teeth jutting out awkwardly.
legacy.background: A goose farmer from outlying lands west of town, Partulles has a long history of arguments and scuffles with the local townsfolk.

legacy.name: The Night
legacy.appearance: Descriptions vary wildly between *eyewitness* accounts. Purportedly garbed in white, silver, and gold, this woman is described as holding herself with both grace and strength.
legacy.background: While many claim the Night Swan is an ancient and mythical fey, others claim it is a simple bandit. Either way, attacks are recent and relatively frequent, and most attacks on the road are attributed to The Night Swan, deserved or not.

prison.title: Grand Prince
prison.appearance: Dressed perfectly in regal attire, his clothes don't show even a hint of wear. He smiles often and slightly too widely.
prison.background: Grand Prince Stavian III is considered as ineffectual as the empire he rules. For all Stavian’s faults, he has managed to hold the empire together through intelligent political maneuvering and a keen understanding of human nature. Was recently found alive but mad, and has been turned over to the Lion's Blades and sent into exile. Only a handful of people know where he is now.
prison.death: Fatally stabbed by a Lion's Blade during the Exaltation Massacre, his body was recovered by imperial magisters.

prison.title: Viscount
prison.name: Theon
prison.appearance: Dressed in muted colors and lacking ostentatious jewelry, Viscount Theon Cenabri stands out in this particular crowd as the only noble not wearing flashy jewels. He might be mistaken for a servant were in not for his expensive and well-recognized signet ring and frequent appearance at state events.
prison.background: A distant descendant of Italice Cenabri, who was murdered by Honaria Alcasti's Lieutenant, this particular viscount is remarkable in that while he has done little more than coast on his family name, he has done nothing scandalous to harm his family name, and he treats his servants better than most. Invested in protecting his family's name, he has a quiet but deep hatred for Remaio Alcasti and those who assisted to restore his family's name.

prison.name: Lucretzia
prison.appearance: Thin and pale Lucretzia spends her time behind bars spouting Galtean rhetoric at those who come within earshot. While Martella has been trying to reach out to the *Night Swan,* the reality of her crimes and her utter lack of remorse leaves the two at an impasse, one that neither of them are in a hurry to overcome.
prison.background: Born to wealth and educated by the best tutors, Lucretzia is a noble and some important nobles cousin, though she never goes into details. Recently exposed as the *Night Swan,* she's been arrested and imprisoned at the palace of birdsong, though most of the citizenry of Meratt find it hard to believe that she was behind so many crimes.
prison.weakness: Lucretzia has a solid appreciation for Galtan history and writing, and couching new ideas in relation to revolutionary writers is sure to make an impression.

secrown.title: Duke
secrown.name: Quintus Avellius
secrown.appearance: Often seen wearing fine livery, Quintus Corcina rarely goes anywhere without a definite business interest, and is thereby never seen without being surrounded by an entourage of nobles, businessmen, lawyers, and servants. He always makes sure he handles money personally, he never drinks until after business is concluded, and he always hosts or otherwise pays for food at a dinner, preventing anyone from getting the upper hand on him in a business negotiation.
secrown.background: The ambitious members of House Corcina first made their mark on Taldan history during the time of the Second Army of Exploration, when the house' founders great success gained him both land and a bride of royal blood. Now under the shrewd leadership of Duke Quintus Corcina, the house continues to not only grow but thrive through its foreign trade networks. Corcina trade routes stretch the length of Avistan, but the duke seeks to extend them further still, including a bold expansion into Tian Xia.

secrown.title: Duchess
secrown.name: Helinara
secrown.appearance: With short-cropped red hair, she is always seen wearing her grandmothers emerald tear neckless choker. While she looks young, she has a sharp wit honed from spending her life around people trying to take economic advantage of her lands, so she speaks decisively and with carefully chosen words.
secrown.background: Receiving the backing from several tracks of farmland, a few small counties, and the Historical Old Sehir, Helinara Lawsus was already administering via the communal opinions of various tribunes and baronies. While not particularly strong on their own, this coalition is large enough to make their voice heard, while also demonstrating the potential of alternative-governing methods that are still tied to Taldan's noble traditions.
secrown.biases: She has a fondness for martial classes and craftsman, and doesn't really care for bards or sorcerers as they tend to twist words of others.
secrown.strengths: She knows the law alarmingly well.
secrown.weakness: When multiple people express the same opinion, she's more likely to listen.
secrown.skills: Bluff, Diplomacy, K: History, K: Nobility, ???

secrown.title: Marquess
secrown.name: Tanasha
secrown.appearance: A gnome with beautifully styled rainbow hair and a glowing smile, Tanasha dresses in the rich greens of the Verduran Forest with a stylized broach denoting the city of Wispil at her shoulder.
secrown.background: An avid supporter of gnome rights and a prior vocal supporter of Princess Eutropia, she's taken advantage of the current confusion to make her own claim for the Priomogen crown, hoping to leverage Wispil's relative isolation, strategic value, and military might during the War for the Crown.
secrown.biases: Tanasha despises anyone who mistreats servants, or small folk (–2), but she adores anyone who treats servants as equals or comes from a short-raced background (+2).
secrown.strengths: Having a firm grasp of the land, attempts to persuade her through lies about nature or its animals or attempts to bluster their own importance brings out Tanasha's skepticism.
secrown.weakness: While cheerful and exciting, Tanasha is feeling worn since the massacre. Welcoming any excuse for a colorful exchange or impromptu display of frivolity, she may be open to more bombastic characters that seek to get the Marquess to their side.
secrown.skills: Diplomacy, Bluff, K: Arcana, and Spellcraft

secrown.title: Count
secrown.name: Caliphalig
secrown.appearance: Having learned to always be ready for an ambush, Caliphalig Vort is rarely seen without his armor, weapons, and a couple bodyguards.
secrown.background: Baronet Caphridius Vort's cousin, Caliphalig controls the County of Lionsmane immediately bordering Meratt and lies between them and Cassomir. With swampy lands laden with canals he is bound to maintain, coupled with fey, ettercaps, and a stubborn dragon, yet also being within the critical heartland of Taldor and essential for shipping between its two largest cities, Oppara and Cassomir, Caliphalig employs an army and a series of militias to rival that of a Marquess and has the loyalty - earned or enforced - of his people.

secrown.title: Knight
secrown.name: Remilliard
secrown.appearance: In the gold-and-crimson plate of Ragathiel, Remilliard stands self-assuredly, his golden hair tied back from his clean-shaven face. Alert blue eyes glance towards any he thinks as trouble and they spark in fury at the idea of peace with modern Cheliax.
secrown.background: Descendant of the Kastner family that remained in Taldor, Remilliard has taken his family’s senate seat and uses his position to fight for progressive change within Taldor.
secrown.biases: He does not talk with evil characters (-all) and does not approve of selfish, non-good lifestyles (-2). He appreciates all who are good of heart (+2).

target.title: Chacoom
target.name: Vul
target.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. Vul sticks out thanks to his eyebrows, and the Yashtoma he often carries with him while officiating, a quirk that makes him easy to recognize.
target.background: The Councilor of Seeds, Croafto represents Sayashto's iconic Yashtoma industry and deals with affairs of agriculture, parks, and pest control.

target.title: Chacoom
target.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
target.background: The former Councilor of Gates, Eopal was in charge of publicity, immigration, tourism, and trade. He suddenly resigned a short time ago and secluded himself at home, which is especially odd considering that he was only 340 days into his 2,000 day term.

target.title: Chacoom
target.appearance: A proud cleric of Abadar from the city of Brass, Hlati is one of ony six dozen Azer's in Sayashto, and the only one that carries a warhammer as part of his oficial capacity.
target.background: The Councilor of Canals, Hlati is responsible for coordinating Sayashto's roads, bridges, and canals, along with informally representing the interests of neighboring districts.

target.title: Chacoom
target.name: Trakt
target.appearance: Like the vast majority of Axiomites, Trakt is a craftsman and an enchanter, and he can easily be recognized by the specific geometry leaking through his flesh, that is, to anyone who can read divine geometry and comprehend it.
target.background: The Councilor of Laws, Imil differs from the other, elected, councilors by being an advisor appointed by authorities in Aktun to represent Axis as a whole. This role is more of an advisory role, though it does carry the authority to veto measures entirely should they deem it necessary.

target.title: Chacoom
target.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
target.background: The Councilor of Graves, Jolmulk oversees legislation for the local mortuary industry, presides over major holidays, and serves as a symbolic representative for the district's long-term residents.

target.title: Lieutenant
target.appearance: Lieutenant Fanalyx is a unique, though not unheard of, sight in Axis, being an Axiomite detective on the police force rather than elsewhere in administration. She wears the rank of Lieutenant on an approved set of magical clothing, denoting her office as mortals would instead of wearing them attached to her skin.
target.background: Although utterly loyal to Axis and its principles, Fanalyx is a detective willing to explore unconventional solutions and work with untested strangers to keep her district safe.

target.title: General
target.appearance: Other than her otherwordly eyes, wings, and energy, Ohalia looks much like how she's depicted in historical art - a fierce woman wearing a breastplate and wielding a spear.
target.background: Over thousands of years ago, Ohalia served served as Taldaris' General, accompanying the First Emperor on battlefields across the chaotic inner-sea during the period of post-starfall city-states.

target.title: Special Agent
target.appearance: Usually seen peacefully drinking yasht at Pakhtil's, Qarit is polite though often nihilistically dismisive of others, and he positively exudes dread, bothering many of those whom are not immune.
target.background: An embodiement of death, Qarit is a powerful Shinigami that has pursued dangerous fugitives, despoilers, and the unnaturally long-lived for more than 10,000 years.

target.title: Officer
target.appearance: A powerful Impariut, Taldaris has not been seen in public for some time, though it's just assumed he is away on assignment. However, he was briefly seen in a vision in chains.
target.background: As a mortal, Taldaris founded one of Golarion’s greatest empires; a legend and an icon for more than six thousand years. In death, he is an unshakable force of justice in service to Axis.

target.title: Chief Custodian
target.appearance: One of many eternally-helpful Arbiter's manning Axis, the other Arbiter's at the Hall of Final Deeds make a half-bow whenever he passes, denoting his seniority.
target.background: In charge of maintaining the Hall of Final Deeds and helping to tend to the fallen, the listless, and the people coming to pay respects, Iphalt-C is designed to assist those visiting or residing in Sayashto's graveyard.

target.title: Agent
target.appearance: With a deeply penetrating stare, Jihtin locks eyes with his target and wont ever let them escape until he's sold them the Home of their Dreams!
target.background: A fabulously successful real-estate agent, Jihtin loves showing off the magical properties of the Specie Spring located in the center of the upscale neighborhood of the same name.

target.title: Chief Postal Inspector
target.appearance: The tall, blue-skinned Omaln wears in loose, flowing robes, and his strange face has too many eyes while his hands have too few fingers.
target.background: The Chief Postal Inspector of the Sayashto Postal Service, Omaln has been consistently revising quality-control procedures with little effect as she struggles to meet Zdareen District Standards.

target.title: Lord Squire
target.appearance: An adorable Tamarin, this monkey has several other tamarins guarding his person at all times and walks the streets with an heir of protectiveness and propriety.
target.background: The reigning lord of the Order of the Eaves, this tamarin directs his massive troop to patrol Sayashto, deliver messages, and run minor errands.

target.title: Head Curator
target.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
target.background: A renown interplanar botanist, Head Curator Zjali administrates the Striped Palace, a museum dedicated to the history, cultivation, and processing of the yashtoma plant.

target.name: Higgins
target.appearance: Friendly and subservient, Higgins dressess simply and cherily addresses his customers needs despite being wealthy enough to own a shop in Axis while still being mortal.
target.background: The proprieter and head barber at Silver Snips, Mister Higgins coordinaates his crew of halfling barber-surgeons with precision while creating an enviornment where people like to hang out, chat, and post help-wanted adds.

target.title: Petitioner
target.appearance: Petitioners in Axis look much like they did in life, though their skin is rounded and hued in blue and they are typically devoid of hair and any disfigurement, and they have writing all over their bodies - a personalized puzzle to solve which may take a lifetime to decipher, if they ever manage it. The most distinguishing thing about a Petitioner to an outsider is their cloathing and their writtings, something that makes it easy to tell them apart as you know them for decades, but much harder for people new in Axis to recognize, meaning some new or less-detail oriented people struggle to tell them apart.
target.background: Founder and proprietor of Sayashto's oldest and most popular Yasht Shop, Pakhtil smuggly insists that she sells the best yasht in existance, and based on the long lines that form during the morning rush, she's probably right.
